rundown: 4-19 L @ Philadelphia Phillies Cal Quantrill: 3.1 innings, 9 earned runs, 9 hits, 4 HR, 0 strikeouts Batters: Matt Olson (1 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Michael Harris II (1 hits - 4 AB, 2 RBI) The Braves suffered a heavy defeat against the Philadelphia Phillies, allowing 19 runs while only managing to score 4. The loss was largely attributed to Cal Quantrill's struggles on the mound, giving up 9 earned runs in just over 3 innings of work. Key highlights from the game include: 1. Matt Olson hit a home run and contributed 1 RBI, but it wasn't enough to turn the tide. 2. Michael Harris II drove in 2 runs, showcasing some offensive potential despite the overall team performance. 3. The Braves' pitching staff struggled significantly, allowing 20 hits and 4 home runs to the Phillies.
